FuncDef:
The trap-threshold output-error command sets an upper threshold, lower threshold, and detection interval for the input or output error alarm.
The undo trap-threshold output-error command restores the upper threshold, lower threshold, and detection interval of the input or output error alarm to the default values.
By default, the high alarm threshold for output errors is 1000, the low threshold is 100, and the interval is 10 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an upper alarm threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295 .
The default value is 1000 .

Specifies a lower alarm threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295 .
The default value is 100 .

Specifies a detection interval for input or output errors.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535 .
The default value is 10 .

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an upper threshold, lower threshold, detection interval for the input or output error alarm, run the trap-threshold { input-error | output-error } command. After this configuration is performed, a device generates an alarm and sends it to an NMS only when the number of input or output error frames reaches the upper threshold for three consecutive detection intervals. The device sends a clear alarm to the NMS only when the number of input or output error frames falls below the lower threshold for three consecutive detection intervals.
Precautions
The configured thresholds take effect only when output alarm function is enabled. You can run the snmp-agent trap enable port output-error command to enable the input or output alarm function on an interface.
The value of high-threshold must be greater than or equal to that of low-threshold.
